title: How plastic is infiltrating the world's soils - UNEP
body: According to the Global Assessment of Soil Pollution, as the world's population is expected to rise by 2 billion by 2050, reducing plastic pollution in soil will be key to making progress on the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The report, published by UNEP and FAO shows that global food security is being compromised by soil pollution.

- The provided excerpt is from a December 3, 2021, story titled "How plastic is infiltrating the world’s soils." The article is discussing the environmental impact of agricultural plastic pollution and its potential harm to the world's food systems. It also touches on the necessity of addressing this issue to make progress on the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Additionally, the text emphasizes the importance of World Soil Day, which is annually held on December 5, and highlights the upcoming joint webinar on agricultural plastics taking place on December 7.

- It also delves into the origins and health impacts of plastic pollution, as well as potential next steps to reduce agricultural plastic pollution. Overall, the piece provides insights into the challenges posed by agricultural plastic pollution and highlights the need for collective efforts to address this issue.
